constructs.name: error_resolution_speed
constructs.description: How quickly errors/bugs are identified and fixed - the primary outcome measuring debugging efficiency

constructs.name: developer_experience_level
constructs.description: Overall programming experience and seniority - accumulated knowledge from years in the field

constructs.name: domain_expertise
constructs.description: Deep knowledge of the specific business domain and problem space

constructs.name: system_architecture_complexity
constructs.description: Inherent complexity of the software system's design and interdependencies

constructs.name: error_complexity
constructs.description: The inherent difficulty of the current error - whether it's a simple typo or deep architectural issue

constructs.name: external_interruptions
constructs.description: Disruptions from meetings, messages, notifications, or colleague questions

constructs.name: sleep_quality
constructs.description: Quality and duration of sleep affecting next-day cognitive performance

constructs.name: test_coverage_confidence
constructs.description: Confidence from existing tests that changes won't introduce regressions

constructs.name: documentation_quality
constructs.description: Availability and usefulness of documentation for understanding the system

constructs.name: cognitive_clarity
constructs.description: Mental sharpness, focus, and absence of fatigue enabling clear thinking

constructs.name: stress_level
constructs.description: Current psychological stress from deadlines, pressure, or workload

constructs.name: flow_state
constructs.description: State of deep focus and immersion in the debugging task

constructs.name: codebase_familiarity
constructs.description: Current understanding of the specific codebase, its patterns, and quirks

constructs.name: error_diagnosis_efficiency
constructs.description: Ability to quickly identify the root cause of an error

constructs.name: fix_implementation_efficiency
constructs.description: Speed and accuracy of coding the solution once the problem is understood

constructs.name: code_quality
constructs.description: Readability, maintainability, and organization of the codebase

constructs.name: debugging_tool_proficiency
constructs.description: Skill in using debugging tools, profilers, and log analysis systems

edges.description: Quickly identifying the root cause directly enables faster overall resolution
Faster implementation of the fix directly speeds up resolution
More complex errors take longer to resolve regardless of skill
Being in flow enables faster, more effective debugging
Mental clarity enables better problem-solving and faster resolution
Knowing the codebase helps quickly narrow down where bugs might be
Skilled use of debuggers and profilers speeds diagnosis
Good documentation helps understand expected behavior and find discrepancies
Complex errors with multiple interacting causes are harder to diagnose
Clean, readable code is easier to debug and trace
Clear thinking enables pattern recognition and logical deduction
Experienced developers recognize error patterns and common pitfalls faster
Domain knowledge helps identify when behavior deviates from business requirements
Knowing where and how to make changes speeds implementation
Confidence in tests allows faster changes without fear of regressions
Well-structured code is easier to modify safely
Flow state enables rapid, confident coding
Understanding the domain helps implement correct solutions
Interruptions break flow and prevent deep focus
Mental clarity is a prerequisite for achieving flow
High stress prevents the relaxed focus needed for flow
Good sleep the night before enables mental sharpness
Chronic stress impairs cognitive function and focus
Frequent interruptions fragment attention and reduce clarity
Experienced developers learn codebases faster
Domain knowledge accelerates understanding of code purpose
Experience correlates with knowing and using debugging tools well
Complex systems tend to produce more complex errors
Poor code quality leads to harder-to-trace errors
Resolving errors quickly reduces accumulated stress and pressure
Successfully debugging code teaches you about the codebase
Experienced developers tend to write and maintain cleaner code
Complex systems are harder to keep clean and well-organized
